thread.title: Marvel sets 'Ant-Man and the Wasp' for 2018
thread.title_full: Marvel sets 'Ant-Man and the Wasp' for 2018

title: Marvel sets 'Ant-Man and the Wasp' for 2018
text:
Paul Rudd as Scott Lange/Ant-Man in 'Ant-Man.' Marvel announced Thursday that a sequel to the film will hit theaters in 2018. (Photo: Zade Rosenthal, Marvel)
116 CONNECT 22 TWEET LINKEDIN 2 COMMENT EMAIL MORE Marvel is doubling down on Ant-Man .
The studio announced Thursday that they are adding a sequel to this summer's Paul Rudd-starring film to their upcoming "Phase 3" slate of films, called Ant-Man and the Wasp . "The Wasp" refers to the female superhero who can shrink like Ant-Man. In the comics the Wasp's alter-ego was Janet Van Dyne, but the first Ant-Man film suggested the mantle would be taken on by her daughter, Hope, portrayed by Evangeline Lilly.
ENTERTAIN THIS!
What is even going on in that second 'Ant-Man' post-credit scene?
Ant-Man and the Wasp will hit theaters on July 6, 2018. The new film shifts Marvel's announced slate slightly, with Black Panther moving up to Feb. 16, 2018 and Captain Marvel being pushed back to March 8, 2019.
The studio cited the box office success of the first Ant-Man film in the announcement. According to Marvel it has earned has earned $178.5 million domestically and $231.3 million internationally for a global total of $409.8 million.
Marvel is betting big on Ant-Man. The studio announced that it will be adding a sequel to this summer's film to their upcoming slate of movies, called 'Ant-Man and the Wasp.' With Marvel's movies shuffling around, we lay out what you can expect in the next few years. Zade Rosenthal, Marvel Fullscreen 'Captain America: Civil War,' which will pit Captain America against Iron Man, will hit theaters May 6, 2016. There's a good chance Spider-Man will also make an appearance, because in the Marvel comic story line of the same name, Spidey plays an integral role. Marvel Fullscreen Marvel's 'Doctor Strange' arrives in theaters on Nov. 4, 2016. Benedict Cumberbatch plays the sorcerer. Marvel Comics Fullscreen 'Guardians of the Galaxy 2,' the sequel to 2014's No. 1 movie, will hit theaters on May 5, 2017. Marvel Fullscreen Tom Holland's first solo outing as Spider-Man will hit theaters on July 28, 2017. Sony Pictures Fullscreen Thor (Chris Hemsworth), right, and brother Loki (Tom Hiddleston) will be reunited in "Thor: Ragnarok" on Nov. 3, 2017. Marvel Fullscreen Marvel's "Black Panther" movie moves up to Feb.16, 2018. The film, starring Chadwick Boseman, will be the studio's first to headline a black superhero. Marvel Fullscreen 'Ant-Man' sequel 'Ant-Man and the Wasp' will squeeze in on July 6, 2018. Zade Rosenthal, Marvel Fullscreen With 'Ant-Man and the Wasp' on the schedule, 'Captain Marvel,' which will be the first Marvel film to feature a solo female lead, is pushed back to March 8, 2019. Marvel Comics Fullscreen Marvel will split its third "Avengers" movie into two parts. "Avengers: Infinity War Part 1" will hit theaters on May 4, 2018, and "Avengers: Infinity War Part 2" will come out on May 3, 2019, and both films could conceivably feature Spider-Man. Zade Rosenthal, Marvel Fullscreen Marvel will introduce a whole new world of characters with "Inhumans," out July 12, 2019. Marvel Comics Fullscreen What's next? Not even Thor and Captain America know, but three untitled Marvel films will hit theaters on May 1, 2020, July 10, 2020, and Nov. 6, 2020. Jay Maidment, Marvel Fullscreen Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay Autoplay Show Thumbnails Show Captions Last Slide Next Slide The studio also announced three addition untitled films to hit theaters on May 1, 2020, July 10, 2020, and Nov. 6, 2020.
This is not the first time Marvel has shaken up their upcoming line-up since they first announced it in Oct. of 2014. In February of this year they announced a new Spider-Man film for 2017, starring Tom Holland as the web-slinger, after a deal with Sony allowed the character to join the Marvel Cinematic Universe , which pushed several movies back, including Captain Marvel . That film, which will follow female superhero Carol Danvers, was originally to be Marvel's first film with a female title character, a milestone that Ant-Man and the Wasp will now take.
